name: Thaspium aureum
Relationship: Compare: AGAR.; STRAM.; TARENT.; CICUTA; AETHUSA.

Head: Pressure on top, in right temple, associated with backache
Respiratory: Dry cough, with stitches in chest
Mind: Suicidal; depressed; laughing and weeping moods alternate
Female: Acrid, profuse leucorrhoea, with retarded menses
Extremities: Lameness in arms and spasmodic twitching

details: Hysteria, epilepsy, chorea, hypochondriasis, come within the sphere of this remedy.
